botanical_details.potentially_harmful: Ingestion may cause severe discomfort. Wear gloves and wash hands after handling
botanical_details.genus: Iris may be rhizomatous or bulbous perennials, with narrow leaves and erect stems bearing flowers with 3 large spreading or pendent fall petals, alternating with 3 erect, often smaller, standard petals, in late winter, spring or early summer

how_to_grow.cultivation: It can be difficult to grow in a garden situation as it comes from areas with dry, cold winters, dry summers and wet spring. Though hardy, wet winters encourage growth that is prone to cold damage. Outdoors grow in very well-drained soil in full sun. Best grown in a bulb frame in containers using gritty, free-draining compost, keep dry during the summer
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by seed or by division after flowering
how_to_grow.pests: Slugs and snails may be a problem
how_to_grow.diseases: Can be affected by a virus infection and leafspot
